channel.title: Bioshock Infinite
channel.description:
So I just saw this [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bLHW78X1XeE&feature=g-all-u']kickass trailer[/url] and it reminded me how much I'm looking forward to this game.
The original Bioshock is currently sitting on top of my "favorite games of all time" list, so I'm hoping this game will plow it's way to the top of aforementioned list.
Also, just skimmed through the comments on the video and — Wow! People claiming "Oh this is just like Dishonored" and then Bioshock purists saying "Dishonored stole from the original! Dishonored sucks!" I've honestly never thought one's own personal preference would prevent them from experiencing the grand total of available "fun", for lack of a better term.

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: ChancyWancy
item.description:
I love it. Make a city of igloos on top of the comet and we got ourselves a hit.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Or an underground Byzantine city inside a comet hurtling towards the sun.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: ChancyWancy
item.description:
I wouldn’t be surprised if the Bioshock series expands further and further with more and more wild civilizations collapsing. Calling it now: the next Bioshock will be set in the Super Volcano beneath Yellowstone National Park.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: warpedfreeman
item.description:
gibbelin:

Everything started with System Shock 1. The decaying, lonely settings, the audio logs, the modular upgradability, the excellent writing…the soul of the 'Shock series all started there. Even though Levine didn’t work on it, he’s brought a lot of core elements forward into every game.

yes it is indeed, you are correct.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
warpedfreeman:

Everything started with System Shock 2

Everything started with System Shock 1. The decaying, lonely settings, the audio logs, the modular upgradability, the excellent writing…the soul of the 'Shock series all started there. Even though Levine didn’t work on it, he’s brought a lot of core elements forward into every game.

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
I’m a bit curious about what, if anything, they’ll do after Columbia. I mean, they’ve got flying in the sky and underwater, so what else is there that’s just as crazy?

A 1960’s sci-fi styled moon base? A steampunk underground Victorian city? Those have all been done to death.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Imagine what they could do in the future if they establish all these different “biomes” though. Like if Columbia was destroyed and plummeted into the sea.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
I’d prefer it if they didn’t reuse Rapture, honestly. It was awesome, and it still has some potential, but no more so than a completely new setting.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: warpedfreeman
item.description:
With Bioshock Infinite Irrrational strengthens a style of game not a series, so we will get more worlds as more Bioshock games are released in the future, Everything started with System Shock 2 and now we are getting to infinite, well im starting to see it as the Final Fantasy series. Can be a good idea so the stories wont be overexploited to get something good, i mean if they made every game setting on rapture it could get boring and not impressive so that wont work dont ya.( although they will go back to Rapture in some time but not in every title).

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Yeah, I loved bioshock.

The escort mission was easy, besides, what are you complaining about?

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
BioShock 1 was overrated as fuck because there were like four enemies and the fork in the ending was so obviously shoehorned in at the last second for a bullet point on the box. There was plenty of great atmosphere, but the last maps in the game just ruin it.

That FUCKING escort mission…

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Wasn’t that the point though?

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
*Spoilers for 5 year old game.

The thing that turned me off of Bioshock’s story is that it’s ripped almost directly from System Shock 2 – both thematically and structurally. Replace Atlas/Fontaine with Polito/Shodan and the collectivism of the many with Andrew Ryan’s failed take on Objectivism and they’re borderline identical.

At the very least I know that Infinite won’t have the same problem, so I’m pretty stoked about that aspect of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: ChancyWancy
item.description:
Pyro:

Who said that it was subpar? Bioshock had a great storyline. The world was just so deep and immersing.

Edit: Is that word, ‘immersing’, the right word to use? I’m not sure, but I spent too long looking at it and now it looks like gibberish.

Well, when I said the subpar thing, I meant that there are people out there who are so hellbent on not conforming that they will subconsciously deny the relevance of anything anyone else likes.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: Mented
item.description:
gibbelin:

Linear is definitely the wrong word for Bioshock.

https://wikicheats.gametrailers.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Bioshock_Medical_Pavilion_map.jpg/700px-Bioshock_Medical_Pavilion_map.jpg

My main problem with it – that Infinite doesn’t look set to fix – is that the upgrade system generally just came down to “which way do you want to kill dudes in the face.” There was no real practical difference to your builds aside from shoot with bees vs. shoot with fire, etc.

I found it to be pretty linear. Sure there were side areas, but it still boiled down to simply a divergent corridor crawl imo. I’d agree as well, the minor RPG elements really didn’t come down to much, and for me didn’t really entice a second play through. Infact, after I had killed Ryan I couldn’t care less about the other dude.

It was a shame because I found the world itself to be highly immersive, but again I didn’t find the story to be all that great. It had good writing in regards to the characters, and the voice actors were fantastic but the storyline itself bored me after a while, thus making the twist fall flat.

Thus Infinite doesn’t really grab me. The ideas of the game world don’t wow me like the original, and I can’t even imagine the story or the combat to surpass the original. Could be wrong, but it certainly isn’t a game I’ll be rushing out to get.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: Aiden_Pearce
item.description:
Pyro:

Who said that it was subpar? Bioshock had a great storyline. The world was just so deep and immersing.

Edit: Is that word, ‘immersing’, the right word to use? I’m not sure, but I spent too long looking at it and now it looks like gibberish.

Immersive.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: ChancyWancy
item.description:
The big catch for me with Bioshock was that the main focus, while not apparent at face value, was the engrossing storyline. I know people will reject that and claim it was a subpar story, but I think it was one of the best.

Read full topic

Linear is definitely the wrong word for Bioshock.

https://wikicheats.gametrailers.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Bioshock_Medical_Pavilion_map.jpg/700px-Bioshock_Medical_Pavilion_map.jpg

My main problem with it – that Infinite doesn’t look set to fix – is that the upgrade system generally just came down to “which way do you want to kill dudes in the face.” There was no real practical difference to your builds aside from shoot with bees vs. shoot with fire, etc.

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Mented:

I could never get into bioshock. The gameplay for me just felt really stale. I suppose I went into it thinking it’d be more of a Deus Ex type game but what I got was a pretty linear crawl with some minor RPG elements. Whether or not this was a marketing ploy or my ignorance I’m not sure, probably both.

Well, yeah, the fact that it’s linear is actually part of the plot, not to mention that it wasn’t even that linear to begin with. There were a ton of side areas.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: Mented
item.description:
Pyro:

I think bioshock infinite looks great, and I’m looking forward to it. The new art style doesn’t appeal to me quite as much as the previous dieselpunk art deco, but it looks amazing nonetheless. It’s also a light brighter and more airy, of course, which is nice change of pace from the darker atmosphere of Bioshock.

I could never get into bioshock. The gameplay for me just felt really stale. I suppose I went into it thinking it’d be more of a Deus Ex type game but what I got was a pretty linear crawl with some minor RPG elements. Whether or not this was a marketing ploy or my ignorance I’m not sure, probably both.

Read full topic

I think bioshock infinite looks great, and I’m looking forward to it. The new art style doesn’t appeal to me quite as much as the previous dieselpunk art deco, but it looks amazing nonetheless. It’s also a light brighter and more airy, of course, which is nice change of pace from the darker atmosphere of Bioshock.

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
I like that Dishonored did well enough that it has its own fanboys though.

I hope Bioshock Infinite turns out well. It’s definitely got the triple A production values, I just hope they don’t turn it into a straight up modern FPS.

Read full topic

item.title: Bioshock Infinite
item.dc:creator: Dr_Karamazov
item.description:
ChancyWancy:

So I just saw this [URL=‘https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bLHW78X1XeE&feature=g-all-u’]

Also, just skimmed through the comments on the video and — Wow! People claiming “Oh this is just like Dishonored” and then Bioshock purists saying “Dishonored stole from the original! Dishonored sucks!” I’ve honestly never thought one’s own personal preference would prevent them from experiencing the grand total of available “fun”, for lack of a better term.

You didn’t know this? There’s actually a law which states that you may only like ONE game of any particular genre. If you like BF3 then you must hate COD. If you like Dishonoured then you must hate Bioshock.
If you like Guildwars 2 then you must hate any other MMORPG.
If you like Torchlight 2 then you must hate Diablo 3.

It’s simply not allowed for someone to like several games of the same genre.

Hmmm…I am starting to think that perhaps you have more than one game of a particular genre…I’m calling the cops!

This law exists for a reason. It’s to prevent people from becoming normal civilised people (rather than being total dickheads)

Read full topic
